text: The 2019–20 season was Olympique de Marseille's 114th season in existence and the club's 24th consecutive season in the top flight of French football. In addition to the domestic league, Marseille participated in this season's editions of the Coupe de France, and the Coupe de la Ligue. The season covered the period from 1 July 2019 to 30 June 2020. ==Players== ===Current squad=== ===Out on loan=== ===Reserve squad=== ==Transfers== === In === {| class="wikitable" |- !Date !Player !From !Type !Fee !Ref |- | 30 June 2019 || Saîf-Eddine Khaoui || Caen ||align=center colspan=2|Loan return||align=center| |- | 30 June 2019 || Grégory Sertic || Zürich ||align=center colspan=2|Loan return||align=center| |- | 19 July 2019 || Álvaro González || Villarreal ||align=center colspan=2|Loan||align=center| |- | 5 August 2019 || Darío Benedetto || Boca Juniors ||align=center|Transfer||align=center|€14M||align=center| |- | 3 September 2019 || Valentin Rongier || Nantes ||align=center|Transfer||align=center|€13M||align=center| |} ===Out=== {| class="wikitable" |- !Date !Player !To !Type !Fee !Ref |- | 1 July 2019 || Florian Escales || Stade Lavallois ||align=center|Transfer||align=center|Free||align=center| |- | 1 July 2019 || Yusuf Sari || Trabzonspor ||align=center|Transfer||align=center|€250k||align=center| |- | 3 July 2019 || Lucas Ocampos || Sevilla ||align=center|Transfer||align=center|€15M||align=center| |- | 25 July 2019 || Clinton N'Jie || Dynamo Moscow ||align=center|Transfer||align=center|€6M||align=center| |- | 27 August 2019 || Adil Rami || Fenerbahçe ||align=center|Transfer||align=center|Free||align=center| |- | 2 September 2019 || Luiz Gustavo || Fenerbahçe ||align=center|Transfer||align=center|€6M||align=center| |} ==Pre-season and friendlies== ==Competitions== ===Overview=== ===Ligue 1=== ====League table==== ====Results summary==== ====Results by round==== ====Matches==== The Ligue 1 schedule was announced on 14 June 2019. The Ligue 1 matches were suspended by the LFP on 13 March 2020 due to COVID-19 until further notices. On 28 April 2020, it was announced that Ligue 1 and Ligue 2 campaigns would not resume, after the country banned all sporting events until September.
